title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 34 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 34 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,
lineList.cn: 以利户又说，

lineList.en: Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
lineList.cn: 你们智慧人，要听我的话。有知识的人，要留心听我说。

lineList.en: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.
lineList.cn: 因为耳朵试验话语，好像上膛尝食物。

lineList.en: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.
lineList.cn: 我们当选择何为是，彼此知道何为善。

lineList.en: For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.
lineList.cn: 约伯曾说，我是公义，神夺去我的理。

lineList.en: Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.
lineList.cn: 我虽有理，还算为说谎言的。我虽无过，受的伤还不能医治。

lineList.en: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?
lineList.cn: 谁像约伯，喝讥诮如同喝水呢。

lineList.en: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.
lineList.cn: 他与作孽的结伴，和恶人同行。

lineList.en: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.
lineList.cn: 他说，人以神为乐，总是无益。

lineList.en: Therefore hearken unto me ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
lineList.cn: 所以你们明理的人，要听我的话。神断旁不至行恶，全能者断不至作孽。

lineList.en: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.
lineList.cn: 他必按人所作的报应人，使各人照所行的得报。

lineList.en: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
lineList.cn: 神必不作恶，全能者也不偏离公平。

lineList.en: Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?
lineList.cn: 谁派他治理地，安定全世界呢。

lineList.en: If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;
lineList.cn: 他若专心为己，将灵和气收归自己。

lineList.en: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.
lineList.cn: 凡有血气的就必一同死亡，世人必仍归尘土。

lineList.en: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
lineList.cn: 你若明理，就当听我的话，留心听我言语的声音。

lineList.en: Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?
lineList.cn: 难道恨恶公平的可以掌权吗。那有公义的，有大能的，岂可定他有罪吗。

lineList.en: Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked? and to princes, Ye are ungodly?
lineList.cn: 他对君王说，你是鄙陋的。对贵臣说，你是邪恶的。

lineList.en: How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.
lineList.cn: 他待王子不徇情面，也不看重富足的过于贫穷的，因为都是他手所造。

lineList.en: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.
lineList.cn: 在转眼之间，半夜之中，他们就死亡。百姓被震动而去世。有权力的被夺去非借人手。

lineList.en: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.
lineList.cn: 神注目观看人的道路，看明人的脚步。

lineList.en: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
lineList.cn: 没有黑暗，阴翳能给作孽的藏身。

lineList.en: For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.
lineList.cn: 神审判人，不必使人到他面前再三鉴察。

lineList.en: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.
lineList.cn: 他用难测之法，打破有能力的人，设立别人代替他们。

lineList.en: Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
lineList.cn: 他原知道他们的行为，使他们在夜间倾倒灭亡。

lineList.en: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;
lineList.cn: 他在众人眼前击打他们，如同击打恶人一样。

lineList.en: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:
lineList.cn: 因为他们偏行不跟从他，也不留心他的道，

lineList.en: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.
lineList.cn: 甚至使贫穷人的哀声，达到他那里。他也听了困苦人的哀声。

lineList.en: When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:
lineList.cn: 他使人安静，谁能扰乱（或作定罪）呢，他掩面谁能见他呢。无论待一国，或一人都是如此。

lineList.en: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.
lineList.cn: 使不虔敬的人不得作王，免得有人牢宠百姓。

lineList.en: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:
lineList.cn: 有谁对神说，我受了责罚，不再犯罪。

lineList.en: That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.
lineList.cn: 我所看不明的，求你指教我。我若作了孽，必不再作。

lineList.en: Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.
lineList.cn: 他施行报应，岂要随你的心愿，叫你推辞不受吗。选定的是你，不是我。你所知道的只管说吧。

lineList.en: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.
lineList.cn: 明理的人，和听我话的智慧人，必对我说。

lineList.en: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.
lineList.cn: 约伯说话没有知识，言语中毫无智慧。

lineList.en: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his answers for wicked men.
lineList.cn: 愿约伯被试验到底，因他回答像恶人一样。

lineList.en: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
lineList.cn: 他在罪上又加悖逆。在我们中间拍手，用许多言语轻慢神。
